item.title: Emerald add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "We are all good friends. Friendship is what endures. Shared ideals, respect for the whole character of a human being. " -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Have you felt it too? Have you seen how your best friends love everything about you- except the things that count? And your most important is nothing to them; nothing, not even a sound they can recognize." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "She was in that highly-wrought state when the reasoning powers act with great rapidity: the state a man is in before a battle or a struggle, in danger, and at the decisive moments of life - those moments when a man shows once and for all what he is worth, that his past was not lived in vain but was a preparation for these moments." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Rudolfo Anaya
item.description: "I think that if there is a hell it's just a place where you're left all alone, with nobody around you. Man, when you're alone you don't have to burn, just being by yourself for all of time would be the worst punishment the Old Man could give you" -- Rudolfo Anaya

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Rudolfo Anaya
item.description: "Understanding comes with life. As a man grows he sees life and death, he is happy and sad, he works, plays, meets people - sometimes it takes a lifetime to acquire understanding, because in the end understanding simply means having sympathy for people. " -- Rudolfo Anaya

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Emerald add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A bore is someone who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad" but "good vs. good." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Please don't disillusion me. I haven't had breakfast yet." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I always think of books as being like people. Even the dull ones are worthy of decent respect, but you don't have to seek them out and spend time with them." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Alfred De Musset
item.description: "Romanticism is the abuse of adjectives" -- Alfred De Musset

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "If you truly love a book, you should sleep with it, write in it, read aloud from it, and fill its pages with muffin crumbs." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Eugene England
item.description: "Trust, like Christ-like love, is to be extended not because others deserve it but because they need it, because they can become trustworthy (or loving) by being nurtured in a community of trust and love. We need to extend trust, even if doing so makes us vulnerable to pain and great cost, in order to save our own souls." -- Eugene England

item.title: Emerald add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If both the past and the external world exist only in the mind, and if the mind itself is controllable - what then?" -- George Orwell

item.title: Emerald add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It said what he would have said, if it had been possible for him to set his scattered thoughts in order. It was the product of a mind similar to his own, but enormously more powerful, more systematic, less fear-ridden. The best books, he perceived, are those that tell you what you know already." -- George Orwell

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am too fond of reading books to care to write them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Emerald add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And I like large parties. They’re so intimate. At small parties there isn’t any privacy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Emerald add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is not our part to master all the tides of the world, but to do what is in us for the succour of those years wherein we are set, uprooting the evil in the fields that we know, so that those who live after may have clean earth to till. What weather they shall have is not ours to rule." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Emerald add a quote by T.R. Pearson
item.description: "According to Daddy, that was a time of general lunacy in Neely, but then Daddy has always said there's nothing like a good snowfall to bring out the feeble-mindedness in people. " -- T.R. Pearson

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was never without misery, and never without hope." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Emerald add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description:
"You have deep-seated survival anxieties. And you don't like bigots, bullies, snobs or hypocrites. Subconsciously there are many people you hate."
"Consciously, sir, consciously," Yossarian corrected in an effort to help. "I hate them consciously." -- Joseph Heller
